content.description: Start the northwest corner on an obvious jug with "Slime" written above it. Climb straight up and top out

Start with a left hand as for "Honorable Mention" and a right hand on a sidepull. Paste a foot on the wall and don't barndoor as you reach right and hit a sharp sidepull crimp. Adjust feet and pull off the crimp to get a left hand onto a knobby jug above. From here the climbing is V0 heading straight up

Start matched in the obvious juggy seam above "Uno One Love" graffiti. Climb straight up through some small face holds to meet another juggy horizontal crack and cruise easy climbing to the top. Getting between the two jugs is the crux
content.location: On the slabby west face climbing straight up above "Uno One Love" graffiti

content.description: Start on the west face on a jug about two feet below "HM" graffiti. Climb straight up on jugs. Actually climbs quite well and is a good warm up.Also probably the best down climb location on the boulder

Start on the east face by graffiti saying "Ethan" and a big red splotch (what an artist, glad they felt the need to put their mark on this beautiful boulder deep in the woods). Left hand on a smooth edge in the "h" of "Ethan" and a right hand on a sloped edge just down and right of red splotch. Move straight up with reachy, somewhat technical movements and an airy top out. Wonderful climbing for an easy grade!
content.location: Center of east face by "Ethan" graffiti

content.description: Stand start to the better sit start of the same name. Start matched on the obvious large jug around head level

Start on the southeast corner of the boulder in a sit start. Left hand starts on a sharp crimp at the bottom right of a large "X" painting. Right hand starts just right of the arete, low on a one pad sidepull. Find feet and pull up to a large jug on the right of the arete. From here continue straight up to top out above the arete.
content.location: On the southeast arete of the boulder. Graffiti writing "ESD" is written here and thus the route is named after this acronym

content.description: Stand start the east face on a slopey ledge above "DB" graffiti. Climb straight up on vertical terrain and top out. Flows quite well and has some height on top out
content.location: Right side of the east face

content.description: This is a massive, glacial erratic boulder propped atop a hill along the Midstate Trail, skirting the border between Spencer and Oakham. The rock itself is about 25 feet tall and probably close to 40 feet across. As for climbs, there are at least 15 unique routes, varying in difficulty level.
